intro: Gilia liniflora subsp. euliniflora, commonly known as the slenderleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Gilia liniflora subsp. euliniflora is adapted to withstand drought and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
